means: 调准（望远镜等），对准，校正，校准（机械等）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"使适合，适应"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: adapt, adjust, conform, accommodate, suit, fit
means: adapt ：指人或物在原有情况下作某些改变以适应新的环境或不同的条件，强调改变的目的和重要性。
adjust与adapt含义很接近，但adjust所改变的幅度要小一些，侧重过程，主要用于调整角度、高度、光点等。
conform ：多指与某模式或规则相符，也引申指改变习惯等以适应新的环境。
accommodate ：书面用词，指以外部条件标准改变自己或某事以求得适应，着重改变或调节的有利。
suit ：指适合要求，从而使人满意愉快。
fit ：含义广，指人或物适合或适应某一目的或用途。

sentence.Network_en: Adjust the aerial's position and direction for the best reception.
sentence.Network_cn: 调整天线的位置和方向以达到最佳接收效果。

sentence.Network_en: Adjust the lighting so it is soft and restful.
sentence.Network_cn: 调节灯光使其看上去既柔和又能给人带来舒缓感。

sentence.Network_en: We have been preparing our fighters to adjust themselves to civil society.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们一直在培训我们的战士，以使他们适应普通的社会生活。

adapt v. 修改，适应adjust v. 整理，使适应administration n. 实施，经营，行政

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the senses 'harmonize discrepancies' and 'assess (loss or damages)'): from obsolete French adjuster, from Old French ajoster 'to approximate', based on Latin ad- 'to' + juxta 'near'

entry.tran: 改变（行为或观点）以适应;调节;习惯
entry.def: When you adjust to a new situation, you get used to it by changing your behaviour or your ideas.

example.ex: We have been preparing our fighters to adjust themselves to civil society...
example.tran: 我们一直在培训我们的战士，以使他们适应普通的社会生活。

example.ex: I felt I had adjusted to the idea of being a mother very well...
example.tran: 我感到自己已经完全接受了当妈妈的想法。

entry.def: If you adjust something, you change it so that it is more effective or appropriate.

example.ex: To attract investors, Panama has adjusted its tax and labour laws.
example.tran: 为吸引投资者，巴拿马调整了税法和劳动法。

entry.tran: 整理（衣服）；校正，校准（机器）
entry.def: If you adjust something such as your clothing or a machine, you correct or alter its position or setting.

example.ex: She adjusted her head scarf fussily...
example.tran: 她小题大做地整了整头巾。

example.ex: Liz adjusted her mirror and then edged the car out of its parking bay.
example.tran: 莉兹调了调后视镜，将车子挪出了停车位。

entry.def: If you adjust your vision or if your vision adjusts, the muscles of your eye or the pupils alter to cope with changes in light or distance.

example.ex: He stopped to try to adjust his vision to the faint starlight...
example.tran: 他停下脚步试着让眼睛适应微弱的星光。

example.ex: We stood in the doorway until our eyes adjusted...
example.tran: 我们站在门口直到眼睛适应了光线的变化。

means.word_mean: 1. alter or regulate so as to achieve accuracy or conform to a standard;

sentences.sentence: "correct the alignment of the front wheels"

means.word_mean: 2. place in a line or arrange so as to be parallel or straight;

sentences.sentence: "align the sheets of paper on the table"

means.word_mean: 3. adapt or conform oneself to new or different conditions;

sentences.sentence: "We must adjust to the bad economic situation"

means.word_mean: 5. decide how much is to be paid on an insurance claim

auth_sentence.content: Such patients should see their physician to adjust medication.
auth_sentence.res_content: Such patients should see their physician to adjust medication.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Such patients should see their physician to adjust medication.

auth_sentence.content: We have to adjust to life without that person.
auth_sentence.res_content: We have to adjust to life without that person.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We have to adjust to life without that person.

auth_sentence.content: We'll lose some money and we'll adjust.
auth_sentence.res_content: We'll lose some money and we'll adjust.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We'll lose some money and we'll adjust.

Sentence.sentence: Higher education should be adjusted to the practical needs of society.
What controls remain for the users will be audio-based, so, for example, you'll just have to say "a bit warmer", and the air conditioning will adjust automatically.
Perhaps, the study speculated, having a white roommate helps academically prepared black students adjust to a predominantly white university.

The university has poured resources into peer counseling to help students from inner-city schools adjust to the rigor (严格要求) and faster pace of a university classroom –and also to help minority students overcome the stereotype that they are less qualified.

means.word_mean: (改变…以)适应; 调整; 校正

jushi.english: The field glasses adjust with a screw.
jushi.chinese: 这个双筒望远镜是用螺丝调整的。
